pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:0.5: 83. The training rule on royal compounds
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.2: King Pasenadi of Kosala told his park-keeper, “Go and clean up the park; I’ll be going there.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.3: “Yes, sir.” While cleaning the park, he saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.4: He then went to King Pasenadi and said, “The park is clean, sir, but the Buddha is sitting there.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.6: The King went to the park and approached the Buddha, but just then a lay follower was seated there.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.7: When the King saw him, he became fearful and stopped.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.8: But he considered, “This man isn’t likely to be bad, since he’s visiting the Buddha,” and so he approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.9: But when that lay follower, because of his respect for the Buddha, neither bowed down to the King nor stood up for him, the King became annoyed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.10: The Buddha realized what was happening and said to the King, “Great King, this lay follower is learned, a master of the tradition, and he’s free from sensual desire.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.11: The King thought, “This lay follower doesn’t deserve to be in an inferior position, since even the Buddha praises him.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.12: And he said to that lay follower, “Please say what you want.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.14: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened King Pasenadi with a teaching, after which the King got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.15: Soon afterwards King Pasenadi was up in his best stilt house, when he saw that lay follower walking along the street, holding a sunshade.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.16: He summoned him and said, “You are a learned Buddhist, a master of the tradition.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.17: It would be good if you would teach my harem.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.18: “Whatever I know, sir, I know because of the monks. They should teach the harem.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.1: Knowing that the lay follower was right, the King went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.2: “It would be good, Venerable Sir, if you would tell a monk to teach my harem.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.3: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened King Pasenadi with a teaching, after which the King got up from his seat, paid his respects as before, and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.4: Soon afterwards, the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda, “Well then, Ānanda, teach the King’s harem.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.5: “Yes, Sir.” And from time to time he would enter the harem and teach.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.6: Then, after robing up one the morning, Ānanda took his bowl and robe and went to King Pasenadi’s house.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.7: On that occasion the King was in bed with Queen Mallikā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.8: The Queen saw Ānanda coming and she quickly got up, but her burnished golden dressing gown fell off.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.9: Ānanda turned around right there and returned to the monastery. And he told the monks what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.11: “How could Venerable Ānanda enter the royal compound without first being announced?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.12: “Is it true, Ānanda, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.15: “… Ānanda, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.18: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.1: “Monks, there are these ten dangers in entering a royal compound.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.3: It may be that a monk enters where the king is sitting with his queen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.4: The queen smiles when she sees the monk
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.5: or the monk smiles when he sees the queen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.7: ‘Surely they’ve done it, or they’re going to.’
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.9: Again, because the king is very busy,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.10: he does not remember having slept with a certain woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.11: yet she becomes pregnant because of that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.16: Again, a gem disappears from the royal compound.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.21: Again, secret discussions in the royal compound are spread outside.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26: Again, in the royal compound a father assails his son, or a son assails his father.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.33: ‘The king is close to the monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.38: ‘The king is close to the monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.41: Again, the king sends out the army at an inappropriate time.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.43: ‘The king is close to the monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.46: Again, after sending out the army at an appropriate time, the king orders it to turn back while still en route.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.48: ‘The king is close to the monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.51: Again, a royal compound is crowded with elephants, horses, and chariots, as well as enticing sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles that are not suitable for a monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.53: Monks, these are the ten dangers in entering a royal compound.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.54: Then, after rebuking Ānanda in many ways for being difficult to support … the Buddha said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.55: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1: ‘If a monk, without first being announced, crosses the threshold to the bedroom of a consecrated aristocrat king, when both the king and the queen are present, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6: well-born on both his mother’s side and his father’s side, pure in descent, irreproachable and impeccable with respect to birth going back seven generations of male ancestors.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.10: the king has not left the bedroom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.12: the queen has not left the bedroom. Or both have not left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.16: the threshold to the bedroom is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.18: wherever a king’s bed is prepared, even if just enclosed by a cloth screen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.19: Crosses the threshold to the bedroom:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.20: if he crosses the threshold with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.21: If he crosses with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.1: If he has not been announced, and he does not perceive it as such, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.2: If he has not been announced, but he is unsure of it, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.3: If he has not been announced, but he perceives it as such, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.4: If he has been announced, but he does not perceive it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.5: If he has been announced, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.6: If he has been announced, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.3: if it is not an aristocrat king;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.4: if the king has not been consecrated with the aristocratic consecration;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.5: if the king has left the bedroom;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.6: if the queen has left the bedroom;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.8: if it is not a bedroom;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.11: The first rule, the training rule on royal compounds, is finished.
